description.narrative: Joint Programme on Local Governance. Policy environment, capacities and strategies are in place that enable sustained service delivery. Civic engagement in local decision-making is strengthened and stakeholders' understanding, engagement and coordination with decentralized institutions, systems and processes is strengthened., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Maternal And Newborn Health, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF, the Government and partners adopt improved practices for effectively planning, implementing and monitoring programmes and delivering quality, multi-sectoral and equity focused resuls

sector.narrative: Capacity Development for frontline workers on gender equality
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Policy dialogue and advocacy on decentralization coordination and implementation
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Joint Programme on Local Governance. Policy environment, capacities and strategies are in place that enable sustained service delivery. Civic engagement in local decision-making is strengthened and stakeholders' understanding, engagement and coordination with decentralized institutions, systems and processes is strengthened.

description.narrative: As part of the UN Joint Program on Local Governance (JPLG), UNICEF/UN-Habitat and Hargeisa municipality jointly organized the “Hargeisa City Visioning Exercise”. For the first time ever, children (33 boys, 14 girls) from 5 districts were invited by the local government to participate and provide their views, opinions on how they envision their future city. UNICEF /UN-Habitat jointly with Hargeisa Municipality presented the learning from this exercise at the “First International Child-Friendly Summit” held in Cologne in October 2019. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of districts delivering basic services with UNICEF support
Number of districts adopting and implementing strategies for engaging women, youth and marginalized groups
